snippet: Waiting to develop a vaccine until an epidemic is raging means waiting too long for it to be proved safe and effective, say scientists who are proposing a global vaccine fund.
abstract: Vaccines for fighting infectious diseases, like Ebola outbreak in Africa, are frequently developed to completion only after epidemic is already raging, model that many scientists warn is unsustainable; issue lies in funding vaccine development, which can cost hundreds of millions of dollars; some scientists have proposed creating global vaccine-development fund as means of addressing problem, particularly with MERS threatening Middle East.
lead_paragraph: Waiting to develop a vaccine until an epidemic is raging means waiting too long for it to be proved safe and effective, say scientists who are proposing a global vaccine fund.

headline.main: For Vaccines Needed in an Epidemic, Timing Is Everything
